options: The percentage of profit a company pays out
The annual dividend payment divided by the stock price
The total dividends received in a year
The growth rate of dividend payments
questions.explanation: Dividend yield is calculated by dividing the annual dividend per share by the current stock price. For example, if a stock costs $100 and pays $4 annually in dividends, its yield is 4%.

questions.text: What is the significance of a company's 'dividend growth streak'?
options: It means dividends are paid monthly
It indicates how many consecutive years the company has increased its dividend
It shows the percentage increase each year
It represents the total number of dividend payments
questions.explanation: A dividend growth streak represents consecutive years of increasing dividend payments. Companies that increase dividends for 25+ years are called Dividend Aristocrats, demonstrating strong, stable businesses with shareholder-friendly management.

options: Selling dividends to buy other stocks
Automatically using dividend payments to purchase more shares
Saving dividends in a bank account
questions.explanation: Dividend Reinvestment Plans (DRIPs) automatically use your dividend payments to purchase additional shares of the same stock, often without commission fees. This compounds your returns over time through the power of reinvestment.
